title: Maverick Helicopters Tours on Maui
text:
Expert Videos Maverick Helicopters Maui. Photo Courtesy of Maverick Helicopters Maui 
One of my favorite ways to explore each of the Hawaiian Islands is to view them from the air. Fortunately in Hawaii there are numerous options available to do just that. You can take a parasail flight with UFO parasail , take a glider ride with Honolulu Soaring , or see Kauai from an airplane with AirVentures Hawaii . The truly adventurous can even parachute over the North Shore of Oahu . 
By far, however, the most popular way to see the islands from the air is to take a helicopter flight. Each of the major islands is home to numerous companies that offer tours of various lengths and prices. 
In the spring of 2015 a Maverick Aviation established their first venture outside of the Southwest United States on the island of Maui. About Maverick Helicopters 
Maverick Helicopters, an award-winning division of Maverick Aviation Group, offers guests aerial excursions inside their state-of-the-art helicopters in Nevada, Arizona and Hawaii. Maverick Helicopters flies more than 200,000 guests annually and operates nearly 50 Airbus EC130 ECO-Star helicopters. 
During the excursions, guests not only will fly in the safest and most comfortable tourism based helicopter in the world, the EC130 which is equipped with with quiet technology. Passengers receive the ultimate VIP treatment with live narration, personal voice-activated headsets, individual seating for up to seven guests, wrap around windows and more. Maui Tours 
Maverick Helicopters is offering three tours on the island of Maui. 
Maui Dream 
Mauai Dream is a 60-70 minute full island excursion starting at $399 per person. The trip begins above Haleakala National Park and makes its way across the Hana rainforest, West Maui Mountains and lao Valley State Park. Patrons will experience Maui’s gorgeous coastlines, hidden valleys, scenic waterfalls and more. From the beaches to rainforests, this journey of a lifetime will be complete as guests pass Lahaina, the famous whaling port; Kapalua, one of Maui’s premier resort areas; Kaanapali, West Maui’s signature beach; Wailea, a community with staggering ocean views; and Hana, known for its dramatic seascapes. 
Maui Spirit 
Maui Spirit is a 40-50 minute flight that offers guests the opportunity to explore Haleakala National Park and the Hana rainforest from the air starting at $329 per person. Guests will fly above Haleakala National Park, home of the world’s largest dormant volcano. The flight will take an in-depth look at its moonlike crater and large lava flows. In addition, the helicopter will soar over the Hana rainforest offering views of the jagged cliffs, amazing waterfalls and some of the most isolated areas of the island. Trip highlights will also include the historic town of Hana, Manawainui Valley, Maui’s gorgeous coastline and more. In the winter, humpback whales can be spotted swimming up the coastline. 
Molokai Voyage 
Molokai Voyage is a 55-65 minute flight that allows guests to explore West Maui and the neighboring island of Molokai starting at $369 per person. The journey begins at Kahului Heliport and makes its way past the world’s largest sea cliffs on Molokai. Views of the Kahiwa Falls, among the tallest of Hawaii’s waterfalls, Halawa Valley with ancient fish ponds and the Pailolo Channel, featuring scenic waters and Elephant Rock, will take passengers’ breath away. The flight over Maui offers remote, intimate views of the western portion of the island. Sites include the famous lao Valley State Park, a vegetation-covered lava rainforest; Honokohau Falls, the tallest waterfall on Maui; Haleakala, also known as the East Maui Volcano; the West Maui Mountains and possible views of the Wall of Tears, a cluster of up to 17 cliff-side waterfalls.
